info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:58AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Rabun and southeastern Macon Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 558 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Clayton, or 4 miles west of Black Rock Mountain State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Highlands, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Lake Burton, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Pine Mountain and Scaly Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
